description.narrative: PSL Limited is Indias largest manufacturer of high-grade large diameter (18-120 inches) Helical Submerged Arc Welded (HSAW) pipes for oil, gas and water transmission as well as structural and piling applications for the onshore and offshore sectors. PSL supplies its pipes, which are certified to meet American Petroleum Institute (API) standards, to all the leading Indian oil and gas companies and state government agencies involved in the management of water and sanitation services in India. PSL also exports large diameter pipes to neighboring countries. To better address the needs of the rapidly growing market for SAW pipes and to improve its cost competitiveness, PSL is embarking on a $ 119.4 million investment program (the Project) which is detailed under the section entitled, Total Project Cost and Proposed IFC Investment below. The purpose of the project is to: - meet the needs for the rapidly growing market for HSAW pipes, - improve cost competitiveness, - increase productivity and - enhance product quality.

name.narrative: The project is proposed to be located at the companys facilities at the following locations: - Anjar, in the state of Gujarat, is an industrial/port city about 850 km north of Mumbai on the main Western railway line. The plant site is 22 km from the main Gandhidham Railway station and is linked to the countrys large railway network. Anjar is also well connected by road, as it is on one of the major north-south national highways, giving the company additional logistical flexibility. - Mehsana, in the Indian state of Gujarat, 35 km from Ahemdabad an industrial cum port city about 550 km north of Mumbai on the Western railway line. The plant site is 20 km from the Railway station. Mehsana is well connected by road as it is on one of the major north-south national highways. - Bisalpur, in the Indian State of Rajasthan, in the district of Kota, is about 400 km south of Delhi on the main Mumbai Delhi railway line. It is well connected to Delhi and Mumbai. The plant site is 15-20 km from the main Mumbai-Delhi line and is linked to the countrys large railway network. It is also well connected by road, as it is on one of the major north-south National Highways, giving the company additional logistical flexibility. - Vishakhapatnam (Vizag), in the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh, is an industrial city south east of Delhi on the main Southern railway line to Chennai. It is well connected by train to both Delhi and Chennai. The plant site is 7 km from the main railway line and is linked to the countrys large railway network. It is well connected by road, as it is on one of the major east-south National Highways, giving the company additional logistical flexibility. - Panipat, in the Indian State of Punjab, is about 100 km north of Delhi railway line, is well connected to Delhi by road and railways. - Daman, is a union territory about 200 km north west of Mumbai on the main Western railway line, is well connected by 3 hours by train to Vapi (industrial city of Indian state of Gujarat). The plant site is 2-3 km from the main Railway station at Vapi, The nearest airport is about 150 km away at Diu, Daman. - Pipavav, Distt. Kutch, in the Indian state of Gujarat, a port city about 950 km North West of Mumbai on the main Western railway line, is well connected to both cities 8-10 hours by train to Ahemdabad (capital city of Indian state of Gujarat) and overnight to Mumbai. The plant site is 10 km from the main Rajula Railway station and is linked to the countrys large railway network. The nearest airport is about 150 km away at Diu, Pipava.
